ratings.comment: Mark Browne is the bomb. Guy is hilarious. Doesn't make you buy the book. But go to class, he knows how to teach.

Mark is my favorite B school professor! I looked forward to going to lecture every week! He is the nicest guy and very knowledgable about his field with so many interesting, relevant anecdotes. He has a great sense of humor and doesn't make cold calls feel uncomfortable at all. Exams are simple and straight forward. TAs are super nice as well.

Mark is an awesome teacher. He encourages a discussion in class which makes lecture very interesting. His real life examples help connect the material to the real world. This class is not too difficult. The work load is minimal. The exams are pretty much the only grades you get, and are not too bad (there are some tough multiple choice questions).

Mark is awesome and one of the best teachers in the business school.  Had him for 300 and 620.  He makes material that isn't interesting tolerable to listen to.  He's also very understanding if you talk to him and seems to care about his students.

Best professor I've had so far in the business school. He promotes a discussion during lecture instead of reading from a powerpoint so you don't get bored. He also gives examples of every concept instead of just stating what it is. I highly recommend this class/professor - if you attend class it should be a fairly easy breadth requirement as well.

Browne is the man, plain and simple. Straight-forward concepts for the most part, exams are straight out of the course packet slides. Not a difficult class, but I recommend going to lecture because there weren't many days where Dr. Browne didn't make me laugh at least a little bit. Awesome guy, great class.

He is the man. Takes a class that would be intolerable and turns it into one where you actually learn things with real life application. Almost no work other than studying for the midterms which are easy and straight out of his notes

Excellent teacher! He keeps things interesting and funny so you don't have to struggle trying to stay awake. If you don't understand something, ask him and he explains it until it becomes crystal clear. Very knowledgeable. The only thing I would complain about is that he covered things too fast towards the end because he was running out of time.

Great Professor! He lectures in a way that seems as if he is telling you a story and not just throwing information at you.  He made the information so interesting to me and it probably would have been dull and boring with any other teacher.
Awesome prof!  Made a boring subject really interesting.  Easy A.  No homework and easy exams.

Great professor.  Clearly explains topics. Makes lecture interesting and encourages student participation in lecture.  Not a huge fan of the 180 slide powerpoint he teaches the course with.  Tests are relatively easy and straightforward.
Good breadth course. Material isn't too difficult. Mark's a great guy and tries to make lecture interesting

Great professor, knows the material inside and out. Hilarious lectures that should keep you engaged. I learned a ton from this class, very relavent material even if you won't use it in your career. Highly recommend

Hands down great professor. Didn't have much interest going into the class, but he presented interesting material in a clear engaging way. You can get a semester subscription to WSJ in place of the textbook which is not required. Multiple choice fair/math exams are fair. Great bus. elective if not RMI major.
Funny guy. Makes a boring class fun and interesting. Exams are not too bad but the final threw a few curveballs. Take him for one of those breadth classes for sure!

One of the best professors I have had yet. He is very organized, and his lectures are very interesting. He also gets the class involved and has a great sense of humor. Tests are straight from the notes and are not bad at all.

Very interesting and really funny, made lectures not so bad to sit through.  He uses lots of examples to explain things and help you remember.  And he'll only test you on material from the lectures, I wouldn't even bother buying the book.
Clear, and straight forward.  Smart guy, highly recommended.

Keeps the class moving good, even though the topic can be somewhat boring. Has a bit of humor during big 1100 lectures to liven things up a bit.  Tests wern't too bad and were straight forward.  Recommended.
